com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.localization

Class LocalizationPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.localization.LocalizationPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.maps.MapView.OnMapChangedListener

    public final class LocalizationPlugin
extends Object
implements com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.maps.MapView.OnMapChangedListener
    Useful class for quickly adjusting the maps language and the maps camera starting position. You can either use matchMapLanguageWithDeviceDefault() to match the map language with the one being currently used on the device. Using setMapLanguage(Locale) and it's variants, you can also change the maps langauge at anytime to any of the supported languages.
    Since:
    0.1.0

      Public constructor for passing in the required MapboxMap object.

      • matchMapLanguageWithDeviceDefault

        public void matchMapLanguageWithDeviceDefault()
        Initializing this class and then calling this method oftentimes will be the only thing you'll need to quickly adjust the map language to the devices specified language.
        Since:

      • setMapLanguage

        public void setMapLanguage(String language)
        Set the map language directly by using one of the supported map languages found in MapLocale.Languages.
        Parameters:
        language - one of the support languages Mapbox uses
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setMapLanguage

        public void setMapLanguage(@NonNull
                           Locale locale)
        If you'd like to set the map language to a specific locale, you can pass it in as a parameter and MapLocale will try matching the information with one of the MapLocales found in its map. If one isn't found, a null point exception will be thrown. To prevent this, ensure that the locale you are trying to use, has a complementary MapLocale for it.
        Parameters:
        locale - a Locale which has a complementary MapLocale for it
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown when the locale passed into the method doesn't have a matching MapLocale
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setMapLanguage

        public void setMapLanguage(@NonNull
                           MapLocale mapLocale)
        You can pass in a MapLocale directly into this method which uses the language defined in it to represent the language found on the map.
        Parameters:
        mapLocale - the MapLocale object which contains the desired map language
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setCameraToLocaleCountry

        public void setCameraToLocaleCountry()
        Adjust the map's camera position so that the entire countries boarders are within the viewport. Specifically, this method gets the devices currently set locale and adjust the map camera to view that country if a MapLocale] matches.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setCameraToLocaleCountry

        public void setCameraToLocaleCountry(Locale locale)
        If you'd like to manually set the camera position to a specific map region or country, pass in the locale (which must have a paired }MapLocale) to work properly
        Parameters:
        locale - a Locale which has a complementary MapLocale for it
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown when the locale passed into the method doesn't have a matching MapLocale
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setCameraToLocaleCountry

        public void setCameraToLocaleCountry(MapLocale mapLocale)
        You can pass in a MapLocale directly into this method which uses the country bounds defined in it to represent the language found on the map.
        Parameters:
        mapLocale - he MapLocale object which contains the desired map bounds
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown when it was expecting a LatLngBounds but instead it was null
        Since:
        0.1.0
